intro: Mayepea implicata, commonly known as the tropical mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees in tropical and subtropical regions. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually clustered at the ends of its twining stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Mayepea implicata has a complex relationship with its host, drawing water and nutrients while also providing some ecological benefits to the ecosystem.
